column4: When i installed apache2 from the repositories it had no httpd.conf file, how do i get this quite important file :D ?
you don't.  Apache2 doesn't use httpd.conf, it uses a comglomeration of other config files, which allow for a ton of modulability and flexibility
Damn, then i have no idea why my apache isn't working
First i thought php just didn't work, but then i found out that apache1.3 was the one being used... and then i tried to remove it and now i got no webserver answering on port 80...
And the apache2 server doesn't seems to start
are you sure apache(1) isn't still running?
what error does Apache2 give you?
apache2: Syntax error on line 189 of /etc/apache2/apache2.conf: Could not open configuration file /etc/apache2/httpd.conf: No such file or directory
Alright.  Sounds like you've got config file issues then.  Why don't you go ahead and pastebin your apache2.conf
oh, and pastebin httpd.conf as well
As i said i have no httpd.conf
Eh?  Did you delete it?  You should have one, even if it's entirely comments.
:S feisty, so i'm not relaying on this apache server to work, but it still would be nice to be able to use it
Oh.  Feisty.  Well, it's entirely possible that feisty's apache is broken currently.  You might ask in #ubuntu+1.
anyway, do this: purge apache2-common, reinstall it.  Then pastebin your apache2.conf (and reaffirm that httpd.conf doesn't exists)

Apache problem again... Apache2 is running and working now, but php isn't working. php is installed and a2enmod php5 says it's enabled and /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php5.conf got the right file indexes... and i have restarted the apache2 server a couple of times... also when apache2 isn't running i got no other webservers answering... what could the problem be ?
you may want to try asking in #apache.  But I'll keep trying
